lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv package

Submodules

lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.builder module

class lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.builder.CSVBuilder[source]

Bases: object

A class for building a CSV file from JSON data.

add_column(name, json_data_map)[source]

Adds a column to the CSV file with the specified name and JSON data map.

Parameters:

  • name – (str) The name of the column.

  • json_data_map – (str) The JSON data map to use for extracting data.

add_file(file_path)[source]

Adds a file or directory of files to the list of files to process.

Parameters:

file_path – (str) The file or directory path to add.

build_data()[source]

Builds the data for the CSV file by extracting data from the specified files.

Returns:

(list) A list of dictionaries representing the rows of the CSV file.

export(file_path)[source]

Exports the CSV file to the specified file path.

Parameters:

file_path – (str) The path to save the CSV file.

save_to_csv(file_path)[source]

Saves the built data to a CSV file.

Parameters:

file_path – (str) The path to save the CSV file.

lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.builder.xls_to_csvs_and_concat(input_path: str, output_dir: str = None, output_as_one_file: bool = False) → list[str][source]

Convert an Excel file to CSV files and optionally concatenate them.

Parameters:

  • input_path – Path to the xls file to convert.

  • output_dir – Path to the directory to drop the pdf

  • output_as_one_file – (bool) If true, combine all sheets into one document.

  • input_path – (str) The path to the input Excel file.

  • output_dir – (str, optional) The directory to save the CSV files. If not provided, the directory of the input file will be used.

  • output_as_one_file – (bool, optional) If True, all CSVs will be concatenated into a single CSV file. Default is False.

Returns list[str]:

A list of paths to the saved CSV files.

Raises:

Exception – If output_as_one_file = True and there are no common columns across the sheets

lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.utils module

lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.utils.build_csv_from_json_files(file_path, columns, destination_path=None)[source]

Builds a CSV file from JSON files.

Parameters:

  • file_path – (str) The path to the JSON file.

  • columns – (list) A list of tuples containing column names and JSON data maps.

  • destination_path – (str) The path to save the CSV file. If None, the CSV file will be saved with the same name as the JSON file but with a .csv extension.

Returns:

(str) The path to the saved CSV file.

lazarus_implementation_tools.transformations.csv.utils.excel_to_csv(input_path: str, output_dir: str = None, output_as_one_file: bool = False) → list[str][source]

Convert an Excel file to CSV files and optionally concatenate them.

Parameters:

  • input_path – Path to excel file

  • output_dir – path to the folder we want to put the results

  • output_as_one_file – (bool) If true concatenate all the sheets into one file.

Returns list[str]:

A list of paths to the saved CSV files.

Raises:

Exception – If output_as_one_file = True and there are no common columns across the sheets
